channel.title: verso on HD-DN
channel.description: Recent content in verso on HD-DN

item.title: Breaking Things At Work
item.description: Luddism has been unfairly painted as technophobic; in reality it identified that technology is a political tool used to control and exploit labour, that can and should be resisted.

item.title: Capitalism And The Sea
item.description: In Marx’s conception of industrial capitalism as Exploitative and alienating production of goods The realisation of value through trade and the resulting accumulation of capital the sea is both a site of production (fishing) and a medium for circulation (shipping).

item.title: Liberalism At Large
item.description: A detailed overview of historically dominant strains of liberalism, as embodied by the editors of the Economist. This liberalism is identified with:

item.title: The Emancipated Spectator
item.description: The book is a ‘critique of’ critique of the spectacle, described as the belief that the bombardment of images and spectacles has rendered democractic subjects passive and ignorant.

item.title: Tomorrow Sex Will Be Good Again
item.description: Katherine Angel posits that consent is not enough, that while positive consent is the “least bad standard” for sexual assault legislation, it isn’t equipped to make “sex good again”.
